page.title: 14New Farm.
page.content:
New Farm is owned and run by Mr and Mrs Russon and covers 320 acres. Mr Russon also rents 129 acres of land. They have a dairy herd of 260 Friesan cows and a Hereford bull. Some of the cows wear collars which shows the farmer how much milk they produce and how much food they need. Milking is done twice a day at 6am and 4pm and takes two hours. All the milk is pumped into a 570 gallon tank and is then taken to Boultham Park Dairy.
The farm also grows cereal crops such as winter wheat, winter barley, maize and grass. In the winter months 2,000 sheep come down from the Lake District to graze while the cows are in the sheds.
